item.title: Extended Clockwork Revolution Showcase Highlights Action, RPG Mechanics, Time Manipulation, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/extended-clockwork-revolution-showcase-highlights-action-rpg

Today’s Xbox Games Showcase came with a new and extended video highlighting Clockwork Revolution from inXile Entertainment. The game was first announced at this same Xbox Games Showcase back in 2023, but today’s presentation offered a much deeper look at what we can expect. 

In Clockwork Revolution, players take on the role of a customized character named Morgan Vanette, who lives in a seemingly steampunk-inspired alternate history of 1895, in the city of Avalon in a neighborhood called The Tangle. Part of a gang known as the Rotten Row Hooligans, Morgan navigates a world populated both by people and clockwork individuals, and some that seem halfway between the two. 

Gameplay shows off plenty of sneaking and combat, as well as some extensive customization tools for both character visuals and weapons. But the most intriguing gameplay shows off special time powers that let Morgan do things like rewind time, rebuild destroyed structures, slow down enemy bullets, and in a larger sense, rewrite the flow of history.

There’s no word yet on when we can expect Clockwork Revolution to arrive, but the game is targeting a launch on Xbox Series X/S and PC.

item.title: Pokémon Developer Game Freak Announces Beast Of Reincarnation For PS5, Xbox, And PC
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/pokemon-developer-game-freak-announces-beast-of-reincarnation-for

Game Freak previously teased a game called Project Bloom, and during today's Xbox Games Showcase, the Pokémon developer revealed the final title as Beast of Reincarnation. In addition to a multiplatform release, we also learned it will be on Xbox Game Pass at launch.

In this title, you step into the shoes of Emma the Sealer as you navigate a post-apocalyptic Japan. Along with her dog, Koo, she'll work to find the source of corruption and save humanity from extinction. Beast of Reincarnation is directed by Kota Furushima, who worked on the battle system of Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon and Pokémon Sword & Shield, as well as the sound of Pokémon Legends: Arceus and Pokémon Scarlet & Violet.

"It's incredible to be working with game director Furushima-san and the renowned development team at Game Freak," executive producer at publisher Fictions Mika Kurasawa said in a press release. "We are so excited to show players a glimpse into the stunning world and intense combat of Beast of Reincarnation."

Beast of Reincarnation arrives on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC in 2026. You can see the full reveal trailer below.

item.title: Mudang: Two Hearts Is A Political Action Thriller Set In Near-Future Korea
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/mudang-two-hearts-is-a-political-action-thriller-set-in-near-future

Revealed during the Xbox Games Showcase, Mudang: Two Hearts is a stealth action game that imagines a near future where North and South Korea are set to reunite when a terrorist group attacks the South Korean National Assembly.

Developer EVR Studio describes Mudang as a tactical stealth game. The trailer for the game shows off impressive performance capture and violent action.

The game will apparently follow two primary characters. Ji Jeongtae is an elite North Korean special forces operative and GAVI is a K-pop idol living under constant surveillance who is key to uncovering a conspiracy about how the government is manipulating and taking advantage of the population's emotions.

Mudang: Two Hearts is coming to Xbox platforms in 2026.

item.title: Super Meat Boy 3D Places The Eponymous Meat Pile In A 3D Platformer
item.content:encoded:
https://gameinformer.com/xbox-games-showcase/2025/06/08/super-meat-boy-3d-places-the-eponymous-meat-pile-in-a-3d-platformer

Super Meat Boy was an early point of success for Xbox Live Arcade. The difficult 2D platformer was a popular game on the platform, and though it has never received a proper numbered sequel, it has been given a few spin-offs like Super Meat Boy Forever and Dr. Fetus' Mean Meat Machine.

Super Meat Boy 3D, however, looks to be its biggest follow-up yet. The game is fully 3D and looks every bit as challenging as the games that preceded it. It also features the ghosts of previous attempts, which is a staple for the series.

The game is apparently being developed by Sluggerfly (Hell Pie), Headup Games (Casual Loop), and Team Meat.

The game is coming coming Xbox Platforms early next year.
